content.description:
Start laying on dust and guano with your hands behind a choke stone. Pull on and make a series of tight hands or ring lock moves. After pulling a cruxy sequence, either climb the crackhouse tunel line in reverse and top out as per the Birth Canal (the enduro version) or keep climbing strait and finish as per The Crackhouse (the direct version.) Both versions go at about v6/7.

I find the first section of Yuji's Crack to be the most bouldery sequence in the Crackhouse warranting a grade higher than Fat Crack, but not quite as high as The Crackhouse.
content.location: Facing into the large cave where The Crackhouse tops out find the crack to the right (20ft or so) from the start of Fat Crack. Yuji's crack is the only other crack, besides Fat Crack, that goes all the way into the back of the large cave.

content.description:
Pumpy!

Starting very far to the right of the exit crack on Birth Canal, locate a large chalked up jug.

Traverse left on huge jugs utilizing a variety of heel and toe hooks until you reach the hand crack that exits Birth Canal, or make some sporty finishing throws to the lip off good jugs near the end.

I've heard this route called V4, but I think this rig is best described as climbing a sport route without all those cumbersome quickdraws.
content.location: outside the crack house, far to the right.

content.description:
Start in the Birth Canal and at it's end take a 90 degree turn and climb through fifty plus more feet of fists, twists, hands, and maybe a few tight hands as you wind through a tunnel like cave. At the mouth of the cave bust through a big hands dihedral where the crack goes vertical for a few feet, followed by ten or more feet of splitter hands to tight hands that lead to an exciting finish. The Birth Canal is one crux and the end is a second crux, but endurance over the distance is the true challenge here as no individual section is any harder than 12-/V5 or so. This is without a doubt one of the finest cracks anywhere. It is especially appealing to me because it splits the cave it is in through it's proudest aspect.

There are many other variations starting at the various cracks and going to either side of the cave, including the one that traverses the jugs into the crack. This version is the one generally referred to as The Full Crackhouse.
content.protection: At least one big pad for the lip is quite comforting.  Even though the landing was flattened out significantly, there is still about a five foot drop off you could land half on and half off, so a spotter or two is helpful as well.  The crack itself varies from five or so feet off the ground all the way up to about ten feet off the ground, so a spotter throughout the problem can be quite nice.
content.location: Drive down the Gemini Bridges Road.  The Crackhouse will be right off the road a little before Gemini Bridges if you are coming from 191, and a little after if coming from 313.

content.description: 20 feet of horizontal crack to 15 feet of vertical crack.  If you can establish above the roof in the vertical section it's all over.
content.location: vertical section is right where the long lip traverse problem would enter the cave or top out.

content.description:
I found a new little mini-crackhouse a couple miles from the crackhouse.  It's fun, and quite a bit easier than the crackhouse, so if you're beat down and sad from not sending the crackhouse, stop by here on the way out and get a burn in on this thing.  Or do it as a warmup on your way to the crackhouse.  You're already gonna tape up, so why not?

Start in the very back on a fist jam and a hand jam with your feet out towards the lip.

The topout holds are still a bit crispy, as well as the lip of the crack in the roof.  Give this thing 20 or 30 more ascents and it will be nice and clean, so if you go in the next couple months, just expect a little bit of sand, etc.
content.location:
38.59383, -109.7537

Try to be careful walking from the car to the crack.  It's only 100ft, but there's a bunch of cryptobiotic soil between the road, so tread lightly.

content.description: The Crack Whore is a 25-30 foot off-width roof bouldering problem. Start as far back in the cave as possible and climb out to the lip. A variation "The Crack Head" (11+) is to climb through the squeeze chimmney in the middle avoiding the crux (turning the lip).
content.protection: At least two bouldering pads and a good spotter or two.
content.location:
Take 191 North from Moab. Turn left on highway 313. Drive approximately 10 miles and turn left onto the Gemini Bridges road.

Follow the signs to Gemini Bridges. The Crack Whore is approximately 5.8 miles from the Gemini Bridges road turn-off about a mile before the Crack House.

From the turn-off onto Gemini Bridges Road:

After 4 miles go right at the Gemini Bridges Sign

After 4.7 miles stay left at "Y" following the Gemini Bridges sign

After 5.6 Miles stay left at the "Y"

After 5.8 Miles stay left

Park anywhere you can off the road

There will be a large drainage on the right side

Hike down the drainage to the Rim

The Crack Whore is the on the right
